1.q_string: A copper wire is held at the two ends by rigid supports. At \(30^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\), the wire is just taut, with negligible tension. Find the speed of transverse waves in this wire at \(10^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\). Given: Young modules of copper \(=1.3 \times 10^{11} \mathrm{N} / \mathrm{m}^{2}\) Coefficient of linear expansion of copper \(=1.7 \times 10^{-5}{ }^{\circ} \mathrm{C}^{-1} \quad\) Density of copper \(=9 \times 10^{3} \mathrm{kg} / \mathrm{m}^{3}\)
A tuning fork of frequency 220 Hz produces sound waves of wavelength 1.5 m in air at STP. Calculate the increase in wavelength when temperature of air is 27<sup>o</sup>C.
The speed of sound in hydrogen is 1270 ms<sup>–1</sup>. What will be the speed in a mixture of oxygen and hydrogen mixed in a volume ratio 1 : 4?

A transverse harmonic wave on a string is described by y(x, t) = 5 sin \(\left(0.09 x+10 t+\frac{\pi}{3}\right)\)where x and y are in cm and t is in s. The positive direction of x is from the left of x from left to right.

Calculate the amplitude and the frequency of the wave.

When sounded together, a column of air and a tuning fork produce 4 beats per second. The tuning fork gives the lower note. The temperature of air is 15<sup>o</sup>C. When the temperature falls to 10<sup>o</sup>C, the two produce 3 beats per second. Find the frequency of the fork.

A source of sound revolving in a circle of radius 15 m is emitting a sound of frequency 200 Hz. It completes one revolution in 3 seconds. Calculate the maximum and minimum frequencies of the sound heard at a point 30 m from the centre of the circle (speed of sound = 330 ms<sup>–1</sup>).

A wave pulse starts propagating in the + X direction along a non-uniform wire of length 10 m with mass per unit length given by m = m0 + ax and under a tension of 100 N. Find the time taken by the pulse to travel from the lighter end (x = 0) to the heavier end. (m0 = 10–2 kg/m and a = 9 × 10–3 kg/m2)

An open pipe is in resonance in second harmonic with frequency f<sub>1</sub>. Now one end of the tube is closed and the frequency is increased to f<sub>2</sub> such that the resonance again occurs in n<sup>th</sup> harmonic. Choose the correct option.

When the piston is in equilibrium, the volume of the gas is in equilibrium. The volume of the gas at this point is V<sub>0</sub> and its pressure is P<sub>0</sub>. The piston is slightly displaced from the equilibrium position and released. Assuming that the system is completely isolated from its surroundings, the piston executes a simple harmonic motion with frequency

A whistle producing sound waves of frequencies 9500 Hz and above is approaching a stationary person with speed v ms–1. The velocity of sound in air is 300 ms–1. If the person can hear frequencies up to a maximum of 10,000 Hz, the maximum value of v up to which he can hear the whistle is
